newsitem.title: USA: Torotel says Brockson deal terminated.
newsitem.headline: Torotel says Brockson deal terminated.

text.p: Torotel Inc said Thursday its definitive agreement to sell newly-issued common stock and shares belonging to the family of Torotel's founder to Brockson Technologies Group LLC has been terminated.
Torotel said the terminated deal will cost the company about $110,000, which will be charged to earnings during the fiscal fourth quarter ending April 30.
"The parties agreed that it was in the best interests of the company and Brockson not to consummate the transactions contemplated by the definitive agreement," Torotel said in a statement.

On January 24, Torotel said it signed a definitive agreement to sell 2.2 million newly issues share of common stock to Brockson for about $2.2 million. Brockson also agreed to buy an additional 510,506 shares of the company from the founder's family, giving it more than 50 percent of the outstanding shares of the company.
Torotel said it has continued with its restructuring plan announced last November. The plan, which focuses on the Torotel Products subsidiary, has continued during the Brockson transaction.
Torotel specializes in designing and manufacturing high-power switching power supplies and precision magnetic components.
